Once you identify the topic you have to identify the writer's argument. This is done after you read. The writer's argument is what the writer is trying to tell you.
So the writer's argument is a collection of their ideas that they are trying to tell us.

Item.text: The first section of the chart states that we have to begin with identifying the Persuasive text. This is done when you first read the text and decide if it is a persuasive text
Ok! So first we see if we're reading a persuasive text. What's next?
Item.speech: Ok! So first we see if we're reeding a persuasive text. What's next?

Item.text: Let's continue you two.
_user_ you helped Jordan so much!
Yes _user_ you have! I think we both learned a lot in today's lesson! Cristina can you run through what we did today?
Of course Jordan! Today we practised evaluating persuasive texts! In order to evaluate persuasive texts we must identify the topic, the main argument, and then any supporting information.
Remind me what supporting information is again?
Supporting information is the information a writer includes in their main argument to back up their argument.
Got it!
I hope you two remember these tips as you continue on with your future lessons.
Thanks Cristina! I'm sure we will!
Have a great day you two! Bye
Bye _user_ and Cristina.
I hope you are enjoying the article. Here is another question.
Here is another question _user_ and Jordan.
_user_ and Jordan! Here is the article showing a different side of the argument! Please click continue when you are finished reading!
Item.speech: _user_ and Jordan! Here is the article showing a different side of the argument! Please click continue when you are finished reeding!

Item.text: Right! Then, you locate supporting information within the article. Supporting information helps back up the writer's argument.
So supporting information is anything that helps back up the writer's argument!

Yes! Jordan you are right! Also in this type of writing many people try to use emotional appeals, which means that a writer is using their emotions to get their point across. Emotional appeals are only good in this type of writing only if a writer supports it by facts and not emotion. Emotional appeals that are not backed up by facts but emotions are better for advertisements.
Okay...So emotional appeals are only good supportive information if they are backed up by facts from the writer?
Yes! You got it! Here is the first article! Please reed it and when you are finished click continue below _user_.
Let's continue you two! With the next question pay close attention to what the writer is trying to persuade us to think.
_user_ and Jordan let's take a look at another question!
Next you two have to identify the topic of the article! The topic of the article is the main idea being portrayed in the article!
So we do this by reading the article and figuring out what the article is about? Great! What's next!
Item.speech: So we do this by reeding the article and figuring out what the article is about? Great! What's next!
